intro: Macrocapnos, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and features showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and has hairy stems and leaves. Its botanical name, Macrocapnos, reflects its large, prominent flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and natural habitats.
